title: Is Christianity Oppressive to Women? History Says the Exact Opposite
description:
Is Christianity truly oppressive to women‚Äîor is that one of the most persistent cultural myths of our age? Modern Western society often mocks Christianity as sexist, regressive, or a barrier to human progress. Yet history tells a very different story‚Äîone where Christianity uniquely elevates human dignity, uplifts women, and lays the foundation for human flourishing.

In this episode, Lenny Esposito walks through Romans 16 and shows how the early church shattered ancient cultural norms about gender, ethnicity, class, and status. Paul‚Äôs list of greetings reveals surprising truths: women played critical leadership roles, were trusted with Scripture, financially supported the church, planted house churches, mentored preachers, served as deacons, and were praised for their labor in the Gospel.

We also compare the Christian view of women with the treatment of women in ancient Greece, Rome, first-century Judaism, India (Sati), Islamic nations, and pre-modern Asian cultures. The contrast is stark‚Äîand it shows why women historically flocked to Christianity, seeing in it a dignity they found nowhere else.

You‚Äôll also discover why Christianity fosters human flourishing through community, purpose, moral formation, and redemption. Modern culture may prefer comfort, amusement, and autonomy‚Äîbut Scripture calls us into a richer, more meaningful life grounded in relationships, equality, and sacrificial love.

If you‚Äôve ever heard that Christianity is sexist or ‚Äúoppressive,‚Äù this episode digs deep into the historical, sociological, and biblical evidence to set the record straight.

üëâ Chapters include:
‚Ä¢ Real human relationships and the Body of Christ
‚Ä¢ How church community improves mental, emotional, and social well-being
‚Ä¢ The full historical record of how women were treated in the ancient world
‚Ä¢ Why Paul trusted women with leadership, teaching, and Scripture
‚Ä¢ How Christianity became the first truly multicultural, multiethnic movement
‚Ä¢ Why the Gospel transforms enemies into brothers and strangers into family
‚Ä¢ Why human flourishing is impossible without a transcendent source of dignity

title: Christian Nationalism or Biblical Patriotism: What's the Biblical Mandate?
description:
Christian nationalism has been blazing in the headlines, but what exactly is it?  Is it wrong for Christians to express their patriotism publicly? Here, Lenny Esposito and Daniel Darling explore the complex relationship between Christian faith, patriotism, and the concern raised in the media over Christian Nationalism. They look at  the biblical teaching on loving one‚Äôs country,  the importance of gratitude in fostering a healthy sense of patriotism, the role of Christians in engaging with politics, and the need for discernment in political allegiances. The conversation emphasizes the significance of local engagement and the church's role in renewing society, while also tackling contentious issues like immigration and family values.

Takeaways
‚Ä¢ Christian nationalism is often misunderstood and mischaracterized.
‚Ä¢ Gratitude is essential for a healthy sense of patriotism.
‚Ä¢ Christians should engage in politics without compromising their faith.
‚Ä¢ The government should not coerce belief or dictate religious practices.
‚Ä¢ Local engagement is crucial for effective civic participation.
‚Ä¢ Patriotism can coexist with a commitment to the kingdom of God.
‚Ä¢ Christians should view political parties as mission fields.
‚Ä¢ The church plays a vital role in societal renewal.
‚Ä¢ Immigration policies should prioritize human dignity and safety.
‚Ä¢ A strong family structure is foundational for a thriving society.

title: Why "Love Is Love" is a Lie
description:
In a world obsessed with heart emojis, rom-coms, and "Love Island" marathons, love feels like the ultimate virtue. But what if the catchy slogan "Love is Love" is actually a dangerous half-truth? What if it's blinding us to the radical, self-sacrificial love God calls us to‚Äîand the counterfeit versions that lead straight to heartbreak and hypocrisy?

Join me in this eye-opening talk as we unpack why our culture's fuzzy, feel-good take on love falls short of the Bible's blueprint. Drawing from Jesus' greatest commandments (Mark 12:30-31), John's call to "love one another" (John 13:34), and Paul's blueprint in Romans 12, we'll expose:

The Cultural Trap: From Valentine's Day hype to the "Love Has No Labels" campaign, how emotional, self-seeking "love" dominates‚Äîand why even its champions dodge the extremes (like NAMBLA's twisted claims).

True Love Defined: C.S. Lewis's The Four Loves meets Scripture‚Äîstorge, phileo, eros, and agape. Discover why love without God isn't love at all, and how "allowing free expression" can enable harm (think de-transition regrets and lawsuits).

Loving Inside the Church: Discernment that hates evil to cling to good. Build affection, honor, zeal, patience, generosity, hospitality, sympathy, harmony, and humility‚Äîas a family that rejoices and weeps together (Romans 12:9-16).

Loving Outside the Church: The radical call to bless persecutors, feed enemies, and conquer evil with good (Romans 12:17-21). No room for cancel culture or vigilantism‚Äîleave vengeance to God, and watch "heaping burning coals" spark repentance.

Finally, we'll count the cost: As Lewis warns, locking your heart away leads to damnation. True love risks everything‚Äîbecause it's modeled after Christ's.
If you're a Christian hungry for authentic faith in a loveless world, or anyone wrestling with what love really means, this is for you. Hit play, grab your Bible, and let's renew our minds (Romans 12:2).

What‚Äôs YOUR take on "Love is Love"? Drop a comment below‚Äîdid it challenge you? Like, subscribe, and share for more biblical deep dives. #BiblicalLove #AgapeLove #ChristianTeaching #CSLewisFor

title: God and Allah the Same? The One Fact Everyone Misses in the Debate
description:
The question of whether Muslims and Christians worship the same God has set social media ablaze, with the Roman Catholic Church arguing "Yes" based on philosophical grounds. But is this claim accurate? In this Come Let Us Reason Podcast, Lenny Esposito unpacks the controversy, examining the arguments and highlighting a critical point others have missed. Esposito argues that the theological differences between Christianity and Islam make the "same God" claim untenable, offering a fresh perspective on this divisive issue. From the nature of God to the core tenets of each faith, this episode breaks down why the two cannot be reconciled.


For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

https://www.comereason.org
https://x.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason
https://www.instagram.com/comereason/
https://www.tiktok.com/@comereason/


THE ARGUMENT:

1. Christians worship the one true God.
2. Worship, by its nature, has constraints.
     2.1. People can worship many things in many ways, whether true of false.
     2.2. Different types of worship will have different types of constraints.
     2.3. However, all worship entails some type of submission to the thing worshiped.
3. Therefore, for worshipping the one true God to obtain, one must seek submission to that God.
4. Obedience is a necessary part of submission.
     4.1. If one intentionally rejects the requirements the one true God reveals for worship of him, one is not in submission to him.
     4.2. Therefore, if one intentionally rejects the requirements the one true God reveals for worship of him, one is not worshipping him.
5. Muslims consciously reject the requirements for worshipping the one true God.
6. Therefore, Muslims do not worship the one true God.
7. Therefore, Muslims and Christians do not worship the same God.

title: Should Christian Morality Shape Our Laws? A Deep Dive
description:
Can Christian morality guide modern governance without alienating a diverse society? This podcast explores the provocative question of whether biblical principles, like ordered love‚Äîprioritizing God, family, and community‚Äîshould influence legislation. Dr. Darren Guerra and Dr. Jacob Daneil join Lenny to discuss whether governments share the same moral duties as individuals, such as charity and justice, or if their role is distinct. The discussion traces the rule of law‚Äôs roots to Christian ethics while questioning how far biblical mandates should extend to secular institutions. Should governments enforce virtues like forgiveness or stewardship, or is their purpose purely pragmatic? With rising cultural divides, we examine if Christian morality offers a unifying framework or risks exclusion. Join us for a nuanced debate on balancing faith, freedom, and governance in today‚Äôs world.

title: Why Does God Remain Hidden?
description:
If God really wants us to believe in him, then why doesn‚Äôt He show himself more clearly? The idea that God is hidden, that if he were real he would provide obvious signs to us mere mortals proving his existence is a charge that many skeptics have leveled against believers.  When asked what he would say if after he died he was face to face with God, atheist Bertrand Russel famously replied ‚ÄúNot enough evidence!‚Äù

Today, I bring you a talk I recently gave at the Defend Conference in New Orleans. Here I address the charge that God‚Äôs hiddenness counts against him being real, tackling issues like the so-called missing miracles today, as well as some more sophisticated objections, like those given by philosopher J.L Shellenberg. We will learn why God‚Äôs hiddenness is actually important and good for us.

title: The Cost of Grace: Persecution as Part of the Christian Faith
description:
Although not often preached today, suffering and persecution are intrinsic to Christian discipleship. Jesus Himself foretold suffering for His followers, early Church Fathers, like Tertullian, viewed suffering as a badge of honor and a means of testifying to the truth of Christianity, and suffering through persecution provides every Christian a means to prove and strengthen his or her faith. Martyrdom is not mere endurance; it is participation in the redemptive work of Christ.

description:

title: Pope Francis vs Augustine:  Are People "Fundamentally Good"?
description:
In a recent 60 Minutes television interview, Pope Francis made the claim that people are "fundamentally good in heart." Such a statement by the head of the Roman Catholic church seems to directly contradict Catholic theology, going all the way back to Saint Augustine! Is the pope renouncing the doctrine of original sin? What about human nature and human depravity? Is the pope even Catholic? In this podcast, I'm joined by Reasons to Believe scholar Ken Samples as we contrast Catholic and Protestant theology and help unravel Francis's cryptic comments.

you can purchase Ken's book _Classic Christian Thinkers_ here: https://amzn.to/3VKi8B6
For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org

description:
The Trinity. It forms the center of Christian doctrine, yet most Christians today either don‚Äôt understand it or ignore it as something not important. But if God wasn‚Äôt a triune being, our salvation would be impossible. How can we make the Trinity more comprehensible? In this episode I interview Dr. Fred Sanders of Biola University, an expert on the Trinity, as we explore the deep things of God.

description:
It's no secret we're no longer living in a Christian culture when we see all of the various ways that church has been displaced in our society. How can we share our faith with people who simply aren't interested in religion anymore? By leveraging the desires and the thoughts that people have today to show them that Christianity actually is the answer that they're searching for.

title: What Does Athens Have to Do With Jerusalem?
description:
What Does Athens Have to do with Jerusalem? That question was first famously asked by the church father Tertullian when he was contemplating the relationship between Greek philosophy and church theology. Today, many people wonder the same thing. Do we need all that egghead scholasticism or can‚Äôt we just love Jesus? Yet, for most of Christian history the pastors *were* the professors! It is only recently that some mistakenly separate belief from intellectual scholarship. Listen in to learn just how much Christian scholarship can contribute to the church and why we need both to love God with all our minds as well as our hearts. 

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

description:

Past doomsday scenarios in film may not be realistic, but there are some legitimate cautions we should heed that accompany the benefits of AI. In this episode, Lenny joins the Kirkwood Center round-table to look at the benefits and potential pitfalls of AI, including some areas of concern that aren‚Äôt normally discussed.

description:
Why do we see more incivility in our society today? We read about the increase in mass shootings, student violence against speakers with whom they disagree, and an ever-growing online belligerence. And what's worse is our country and our world are being divided among ideological lines where no thought or no charity is given to the person holding a differing view. Here, our panel explores how we are losing our culture -- specifically how relativism is making people more savage, causing them to lose the understanding of what civility actually means.

title: Fake News! How the Misinformation Police Get It Wrong
description:
What counts as misinformation, disinformation or fake news? Are people so led astray by today's social media that they continually confuse facts with opinion?  Lenny examines a journal article by  political scientists who claim to show how people get their facts and opinions wrong. However, there's a big problem... the researchers themselves don't understand knowledge. By mis-defining what counts as fact, their paper provides an example of how the experts are committing the very error they are lecturing others about.  Find out how to think a little more clearly on this Come Le Us Reason Podcast.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

title: Deconstruction, Doubt, and Christianity: The Bobby Conway Interview
description:
Doubt about the claims of Christianity have existed since the day of Jesus's resurrection. Many young people today are deconstructing their faith based on their doubts.  But what happens when the one wrestling with doubt is a pastor? How does he face his congregation each week? In this riveting interview, Lenny talks with pastor and apologist Bobby Conway about the difficulties and doubt he faced even while pastoring a church. Hear why doubt doesn't mean the end of faith and why Christianity actually gives us ways to overcome darkness and depression in our lives.

title: Crisis of the Shrinking Family: The Tim Carney Interview
description:
We are in the midst of a baby-bust. For the first time in our history, the number of seniors are growing at a greater rate than the number of babies being born, which spells a dangerous future for our lives as well as our culture.  Why has the millennial generation shied away from having kids? What are the *real reasons* for the hesitancy in becoming parents and what can the church do about it? 
In this interview with Tim Carney, author of the upcoming _Family Unfriendly: How Our Culture Made Raising Kids Much Harder Than It Needs to Be_, we discuss these questions and the underlying drivers that disincentivize growing families. it is a topic that should concern us all.

title: Andy Stanley, Alistair Begg, and Confusion over LGBTQ+ Issues
description:
What are we to make over the recent controversies that have encircled prominent Evangelical leaders about their stances on same-sex weddings, transgender grandchildren, and the like? A few months ago, Andy Stanley hosted a conference where he invited a "married" gay couple to speak to Christian parents. Last week, Alistair Begg got into hot water for his advice about attending such unions. How are Christians to discern what the right path is?

title: Balancing Predestination and Free Will (Part 2)
description:
The Bible holds that God predestines all things to work towards his ultimate goal but we're also told that we control our choices and those choices are real.  Is this a contradiction? In this podcast, Lenny explores the apparent tensions between our free will and God's foreordination and shows how both can not only be true, but how a proper understanding helps us see theological questions in a different light. (Part 2 of 2)

We also discuss Gary's research into the Shroud of Turin and his examination of Near Death Experience reports. Join us for this fascinating discussion.

title: Of Locusts and Love: Why A Loving God Would Bring Calamity
description:
The Bible is frequently caricatured as displaying contradictory concepts of God. Critics claim that while the God of the New Testament is a filled with love and forgiveness while the Old Testament God is a God of vengeful wrath. Of course, nothing is further from the truth. In this podcast, Lenny looks at the book of Joel, when God calls judgment upon wayward Israel, and shows how God's actions truly reflect his love and concern for his people. We then turn to our plight today and understand that God can only be considered a loving God if he also upholds justice.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

title: The War Against the Family
description:

Nowhere is this more transparent than in the tensions that are showing up in households. What does it mean that the new sexual politics, these new identity concepts which are being introduced to our children and to our nation are starting to pull apart the very building block of society that is the family? How can Christian parents guard against the state's intrusion into the home? These questions and more are answered by Lenny and his special guest, Dr. Jacob Daniel.

title: Divine Love as the Basis for Morality - Interview with Adam Johnson
description:
C.S. Lewis famously wrote how it was the argument from morality that set him on a path of abandoning atheism and believing in God. The fact 
that moral values and duties really exist is difficult to square with an atheistic understanding of the world. If there are at least some 
moral precepts that stand above all humanity, where do they come from and how can we explain why we are beholden to them? Here, Lenny interviews 
  Dr. Adam Johnson on his new book _Divine Love Theory_ which argues that the best explanation for the reality of moral obligations 
flows not simply from God's nature, but specifically from the love relationship that the three members of the Trinity share.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

title: How Should We Think About the Rise in Mass Shootings?
description:
What should we think about the increase in mass-shootings that have been plaguing the United States? The horrific carnage in Uvalde, Texas is stomach-churning; but it is only the latest in a series of active shooter crimes that are increasing with unnerving frequency. The shock and grief of these tragedies cannot be understated. 

What can we do about this?  Are there any real-world solutions that might actually work? In a deep study, reported in the Los Angeles Times as well as elsewhere, criminologists Jillian Peterson and James Densley laid out four consistent features common to nearly all mass shooters. While much of the political and media talk are focused on one aspect of the fourth point, I think the first three areas need more attention, as they center on the foundational aspects of society: family, community, and a shared set of virtues.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

title: Modern Culture and the Conceit of Affluence
description:
We see there are differences between the older and younger generations regarding culture and what we value. This disparity is prevalent not simply in secular society but also in the church.

In this video filmed during the Apologetics.com Radio show, Lenny explores why young people see the world differently and how both sides can overcome their biases to understand the world in a more realistic context.

title: Christianity, Race, and  Human Dignity
description:
All men are created equal. That's a widely accepted idea in our culture, but it hasn't always been so. Where does the concept of universal human dignity come from and what does it mean to say all people are valuable? Join us for this talk where we explore how only Christianity offers a consistent view of intrinsic human value and why concepts like race should be seen as sacred.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

title: Is Jesus Just a Copy of Ancient Myths?
description:
Skeptics and Internet sites make the claim that Jesus' story is not unique. There were many saviors in ancient religious systems and the gospels were just borrowing from earlier myths. Is this true? See why we can dismiss claims of ancient plagiarism as so much hogwash.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

title: Why Does God Allow Suffering and Evil?
description:
It's a popular objection: If God is all loving, then how can He allow evil to exist in the world? Is God being cruel in allowing evil, or is He just not powerful enough to do anything about it? Does this prove there is no God at all? In this class, Lenny shows why evil proves that God must exist. 

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

In our latest Christianity in the Hot Seat installment, Lenny examines Islamic beliefs and discusses how to effectively witness to Muslims.

description:
Skeptics will charge that the Bible contains passages that promote slavery, sexism and genocide. But how can the true God be sexist? How should we understand commands given in the Old Testament? Why didn't God prohibit slavery if it's such an abhorrent practice? Join us in this class as Lenny shows why the God of the Bible is not immoral or out of date.

description:
Today's headlines are replete with issues of gender identity. How should we understand gender vs sex? What are Christians to make of those who sincerely feel they are transgender? What's the best way of talking about this contentious issue with others? Join us live as we explore a reasoned approach to the transgender question in this session.

title: The Resurrection: Fraud, Fable, or Fact
description:
Christianity has held the resurrection of Jesus as the central pillar of its faith. Take that away and the whole thing comes toppling down. It's unsurprising, then, that skeptics have targeted the resurrection accounts throughout the history of the Church. In this live talk, Lenny looks at the charges claiming the resurrection accounts were either forgeries intent to deceive their audiences or fables that grew to be believed and demonstrates why either position comes up short.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

title: A Rational Approach to COVID 19
description:
As we enter the second month of shelter-in-place, people are asking "Just how dangerous is the coronavirus really?" In this interview, Lenny talks with Dr. AJ Roberts, who worked at the NIH for three years on the first SARS-coronavirus, to get clarity on what the virus is, just how dangerous it can be, and what we will be facing now that the initial wave of infections has crested. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

title: Challenging Science as the Only Form of Knowledge
description:
The popular view in culture today is science is how we know stuff while faith is just a belief. But Christians should maintain they have not simply a belief in the truth, but real *knowledge* of the nature of the world. Here, Dr. J.P. Moreland explains why this difference is crucial to our understanding of what knowledge means and why Christianity has been marginalized in society.

 For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org

title: Interview with J.P. Moreland: Scientism and Secularism
description:
In this special interview, Lenny sits down with Dr. J.P. Moreland to discuss his new book Scientism and Secularism: Learning to Respond to a Dangerous Ideology. J.P. explains the difference between science and scientism, how our culture has placed too much trust in the scientific enterprise as the arbiter of knowledge, and why such trust actually makes us less knowledgeable.

title: The Sickness of Self
description:
The driveness of ‚Äúself‚Äù has plagued humanity since the garden of Eden. Yet, from that time until now, God has called us to be self-less. To consider others ‚Äúbetter than‚Äù ourselves. What it is this ‚Äúsickness of self‚Äù? What drives it? And what does it look like when the Great Physician heals us of this? Are we more prone to selfishness in our culture of radical individualism?

In this engaging discussion, Lenny is joined by Kenneth Samples of Reasons to Believe to discuss the Sickness of Self, how our society is rife with it, and what it means to love your neighbor more than yourself.

description:
The recent novel coronavirus pandemic has many people very scared about their welfare and their livelihood--and Christians are just as concerned as anyone else. In this short message, Lenny explains just how we can have true hope in the midst of crisis, even when the tough times hit.  It's because we can know God is real. Take a few minutes and listen to this encouraging word of hope.

For eight weeks beginning this July, join us on a journey of exploration--uncovering remarkable stories and discovering incredible insights into some of the most significant people and events that helped shaped our Christian faith into the world-transforming force it became.

Did you know the Jehovah‚Äôs Witnesses‚Äô theology was examined and defeated by the early church councils? Or that most of the objections raised by today‚Äôs new atheists like Richard Dawkins and Sam Harris were definitively defeated by a man who lived 1600 years ago?

There is so much of our past that we‚Äôve neglected, and so much we can learn from those who went before us.

description:
If God is all loving, and he wants to save everyone, then why can't he? Shouldn't everyone get into heaven? In this short video, Lenny explains that God does have certain limitations, even if he is all-knowing and all-powerful. Listen in to hear this interesting response to an age-old question

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

title: Christianity Birthed Modern Science
description:
Many atheists today try to make it seem that Christianity and science are somehow opposed to one another. In fact, just the opposite is true. The scientific method must assume certain beliefs as true in order to work at all and it was Christianity that furnished those foundational beliefs. Given how modern science developed out of Christians making these assumptions about God's creation, we can safely say that science as we know it wouldn't exist without Christianity.

 For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: What Do We Mean When We Say the Word "Cult"?
description:
Say the word "cult" and what comes to mind? Perhaps hooded figures keeping people against their will or a maniacal preacher fighting against the government. But the word cult has a religious as well as a sociological sense. 

In this short video, Lenny adds a bit of clarity to the term cult, showing how certain belief systems would actually qualify as cults of an established faith. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: A Christian Response to the Tragedy in Orlando
description:
The recent slaughter at the gay nightclub in Orlando Florida has sparked a variety of reactions. The gunman was Muslim, even claiming to act in solidarity with ISIS and the victims were gay. But, some blame the motivation for the murderous rampage on the anti-homosexual stance taken by Christians. 

It is true that Christians have been at odds with those who lobby for things like same sex marriage. Activists have sued Christian bakers, florists, photographers, innkeepers, and others forcing them to lose their livelihoods. So, how should Christians respond in this instance? The answer is that Christians should love the LGBT so much they are willing to lay down their lives.

In this short video, Lenny looks to the instructions Paul lays out in Romans 12:9-21 and says Christians should show love. We should be self-sacrificial, even when those who would persecute you are being threatened. See why Christians should be willing to step in front of a bullet meant for another, no matter what their political stance is.  For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Let's Change Our Message on Sex: Part 3 - How Re-Messaging Sex Changes Relationships
description:
We live in a sex-saturated culture, one which warps our and our children's understanding. Yet, the church hasn't done a very good job in expressing exactly what the Christian position on sex really is. We hear that sex is bad... unless it is confined to marriage. But that sends a confusing message to our kids. Instead, what if we look at sex the way it is most often portrayed in the Bible, as associated with worship? 

In this last of a three-part series, Lenny explores how changing our focus of sex from fun to hoily changes they dynamic in relationships for husbands and wives. It also elevates those called to being single and chaste as the highest example of faithfulness. person  and For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

We live in a sex-saturated culture, one which warps our and our children's understanding. title: Culture Has Created a Selfish Kind of Rebel
description:
Modern society has emphasized the individual to an extreme. A person of previous generations aspired to become a certain type of individual, one who placed others before self and understood the culture wasn't there to cater to their personal desires. However, all that changed over the last sixty years as young people began to embrace the "me-first" philosophy that has taken over. 

In this clip, Lenny takes a look at the shift in values modern culture has undergone and he cites the prescient wisdom of G.K. Chesterton, who saw the shift coming within the intellectual elite, which helped propel the cult of the individual.  is For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

title: What Does the Bible  Promise "I Can Do All Things" Really Mean?
description:
Bible promises are very popular, with calendars, posters and inspirational quotes proliferating Christian stores. however, do those promises really mean what we think? 

In this short video, Lenny demonstrates how taking a verse out of its context can distort the message the Scriptures actually convey. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason

title: How SciFi Smuggles in a Godless Humanity
description:
Our media shapes our culture in many ways. Popular television and film can offer viewpoints that are antithetical to Christian beliefs. Sometimes this happens overtly. Other times its more subtle.

In this short clip, Lenny highlights two key filmmakers‚ÄîGene Roddenberry, creator of Star Trek and Joss Whedon who created Firefly and several wildly popular Marvel features‚Äîand demonstrates how their worldview leaks onto the screen, influencing their viewers.For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

title: Should Christians Not Judge Non-Believers?
description:
The command "Judge not lest ye be judged" is ne of the most often quoted in the Bible. Less frequently cited but perhaps more applicable is the passage in 1 Corinthians 5 where Paul tells Christians to not judge non-Christians?  What are we to make of these passages? 

In this short video, Lenny brings some clarity to these verses and leans on vearious examples from the Bible to show just what Paul and Jesus are saying. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: "Where Two Or Three Are Gathered" Doesn't Mean What You Think!
description:
It's almost commonplace for church leaders and Christians in general to refer to Matthew 18:20, which says "For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst of them." They try to use this verse to prove that Jesus can be found in the fellowship of believers. However, in doing so, they are twisting the scriptures just as much as a Mormon or one of Jehovah's Witnesses do. 

In this short clip, Lenny explains what Matthew 18:20 really means and why it's important to use the scriptures properly, especially in church settings. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Infertility And Christian Families: What's The Right Thing To Do?
description:
Many Christian couples yearn for a child but fertility issues have thwarted their efforts.  Now, the medical community has undergone an explosion in new reproductive technologies, promising success where there was previously no hope. But with the promise, they also bring new questions on how Christians should approach such techniques.

In this video, Lenny explains various techniques and the potential dangers that accompany them. He also offers specific questions Christians should ask before embarking on in-vitro fertilization. This is the first in a multi-part series on reproductive technologies and the Christian. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: What Does "Thou Shalt Not Judge" Really Mean?
description:
One of the most often quoted verses in the Bible is also one of the most misunderstood--by Christians and non-Christians alike. Just what did Jesus mean when he commanded his followers not to judge in Matthew 7? Does this mean Christians cannot criticize any action by someone else? No; the command was focused on another idea prevalent in Jesus' day.  

In this short video, Lenny explains how Jesus' listeners would have understood his words and how we can apply them today. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: How to Know God's Willl For Your Life
description:
Have you ever wondered what God has prepared for your life? How can I be certain my desires match his plan?  Do you want Him to use you  like He did to the heroes in the Bible? 

In this chapel devotion presented before a high school group, Lenny explains one way God prepares us for the calling He has for us. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://twitter.com/comereason

title: Culture Has Created A Selfish Kind Of Rebel
description:
It's no secret that Western societies is pulling away from their Christian roots. How did modern culture get to this point and what does it mean?  In this short clip, Lenny reviews how the culture shifted as we became more successful and how authors like G.K. Chesterton predicted the meaninglessness  that would result.  For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

title: Witnessing Tips: Identifying Logical Fallacies
description:
Christians can sometimes get intimidated when others throw out objections to the Gospel message. However, many times the objections offered are a result of bad reasoning or biased thinking. 

In this short video clip, Lenny identifies several logical fallacies that are frequently volleyed against Christians and provides ways to show how to defeat flawed logic.  

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Why Doesn't God Just Make Everyone Love Him?
description:
One of the objections to the Christian message of salvation is that those who don't follow the Christian God are condemned to eternal torment.  But, if God is all powerful, couldn't he just have created people who would automatically love him?  in this short clip, Lenny answers that objection by demonstrating that any compulsion to love created by God wouldn't really be love at all. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Is God An Egomaniac In Desiring Worship?
description:
One of the more flimsy objections to the concept of God I've heard is "Why would God create beings so they could just turn around and praise him? Doesn't that seem needy or egotistical? Why does an all-powerful God need us to worship him?" The question displays both a superficial understanding of what worship is and how it shapes the believer. It also demonstrates an amazing level of arrogance by the person who thinks that he should never have to show deference to his creator. 

In this short video, Lenny explains why t is both decent and proper that human beings should worship a God of love who created them. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Who Counts as a Christian?
description:
Mormons claim to be Christians as do Jehovah's Witnesses. But each belief system contradicts the other as to what kind of being Christ is and both contradict historic Christianity. Is there some way to understand who is a Christian and who is not? 

Looking back in history, the answer is yes. In this short video, Lenny reviews both the need for an objective standard that defines the minimal beliefs of a Christian as well as how the early church codified that standard. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: To Draw Closer To God You'll Need Theology
description:
Ever heard anyone say, "I don't need all that book-learning. Just give me Jesus and that's enough for me"? It's become common in the church to base our understanding of God on our feeling of him instead of our knowledge of him. In this short clip, Lenny  demonstrates from C.S. Lewis and from the Bible why the study of theology is crucial for the Christian to grow closer to the God we love. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org

title: Identifying Impostor Christianity: Defining What it Means to be a Christian
description:
What does it mean to be a Christian? Just because someone claims to be a Christian, doesn't mean they are any more than claiming to be a superhero gives one super powers. Words matter and defining a Christian has become a more and more difficult thing. 

Listen to this short video‚Äîthe second in our series on impostor Christianity‚Äîto learn more of why knowing what is required to be a Christian is crucial. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Identifying Impostor Christianity: The Danger Of Being Deceived
description:
What really defines Christianity? Mormons claim that they are Christians, simply another denomination. So do others who differ on Jesus' identity. What are the essentials of the Christian faith and how can we identify orthodox beliefs from heterodoxy or heresy? 

In this short video, Lenny demonstrates why it's crucial for all Christians to be able to know what are the essential beliefs of Christianity and the dangers of being misled. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Archaeology and the Bible: The Struggle Of The Archaeologist
description:
Archaeology has confirmed biblical places and people over and over again. Yet, the discipline of archaeology isn't as simple as many would think. How does archaeology work and what are the difficulties the archaeologist faces when trying piece together events of the past?

In this video, Lenny explains just what archaeologists must wrestle with to provide a clearer picture of past civilizations and events. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Archaeology And The Bible: Why Archaeology is Important
description:
The Bible is unique among sacred texts in that it is set against a historical backdrop. Do recent archaeological discoveries validate or discredit the Biblical accounts? In this introductory video to the series, Lenny explains the relationship between archaeology and biblical studies, as well as how archaeology bolsters the faith of the believer.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: What Archaeology Can And Can't Do
description:
Archaeology has helped the biblical scholar put together a lot of pieces from the stories of the Bible. It has shown many places and events to be true. Yet, archaeology cannot be the silver bullet that proves God's existence or that the Bible is his inspired word.

In this short clip, Lenny outlines just how archaeology can illuminate the biblical accounts and why it isn't the last word on faith. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: How Archaeology Confirms the Bible: Jericho
description:
Everyone know the story of Joshua's army marching around the walls of Jericho until they collapsed, allowing the Israelites to take the city. It's a famous story, and if true would provide evidence for both God's existence and the validity of the Bible.  

Archaeologists have known for years where Jericho is and they've conducted many excavations at the site of the city, searching to reconstruct its history along the way. Was there a battle in Jericho like the one describe in the Bible?  In this video, Lenny explores recent finds in archaeology and how they support the biblical accounts.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: How Archaeology Confirms the Bible: Hazor, David and Solomon
description:
Did Joshua really exist and conquer the Canaanite lands? Were King David and King Solomon myths invented to encourage returning Israel exiles to look for a glorious united kingdom that never existed? 

Watch this short video where Lenny explains how more and more of the biblical accounts are confirmed by evidence discovered with the archaeologist's spade.  For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: How Archaeology Confirms The Book Of Daniel
description:
The Bible contains many prophecies such as those in the book of Daniel that tell of future kingdoms with remarkable accuracy. This has lead some skeptics to claim Daniel was invented after the fact, making up the stories it reports in order to gain credibility. 

In this short clip, Lenny explains just one minor detail from the book of Daniel that demonstrates the book was written by someone with first hand knowledge of the inner workings of the Babylonian government and therefore could not be fabricated centuries later. 

This is one part of a larger series examining Archaeology and the Bible. Check the Come Reason YouTube channel for other clips. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: How Can We Know God Exists from Creation?
description:
Christians hold that God exists , but is it only a claim based on nothing more than pure faith? The answer is no. By looking at creation and seeing its design we have evidence of God's existence. 

In this short video, Lenny reviews some of the primary arguments for God's existence and shows why believing in God is the most reasonable position one can hold. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: How Christian Faith is Based on Fact
description:
Faith for the Christian is anything but blind. In this short clip, Lenny answers a question from a student, explaining how Christianity has always been a belief system based on evidence and reason and why the modern mischaracterization of faith as something opposed to reason is completely wrong.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Learning about Sexual Purity from A Christmas Story
description:
Everyone loves the holiday movie A Christmas Story. It's become a family favorite in my house. It can also be useful as an illustration when talking about difficult issues such as sexual purity with your children. Check out this short video that helps kids understand a little of what they may lose by becoming sexually promiscuous. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Talking God at Starbucks
description:
Christians sometimes struggle to find ways to witness to others. Asking good questions is one of the best ways to open up real conversations with people while still not offending them. Here, Lenny recounts a short conversation at a Starbucks to illustrate how effective questions are at starting God conversations.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: What About Slavery in the Bible?
description:
"Why would a God of love allow the Israelites to won slaves, even giving them laws on ownership?" It seems to be a common objection by some who seek to demonstrate that the Bible is incoherent. However, as Lenny explains in this short video, the concept of slave in the Ancient Near East wasn't the same thing as it was in the pre-Civil War south. It was much broader, including serfdom and share-cropping type relationships. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Why Did the Culture Shift on Same-Sex Marriage?
description:
The Pew Research Center reports "in 2001, Americans opposed same-sex marriage by a 57% to 35% margin. Since then, support for same-sex marriage has steadily grown. Today, a majority of Americans (57%) support same-sex marriage, compared with 39% who oppose it."

What changed?

In this video, Lenny looks at the rise of the homosexual rights movement. He traces the coordinated effort to de-vilify homosexuality by masking it in popular media and how the Church didn't offer any good arguments against the push by activists. He also tells why it isn't too late to reclaim the high ground in the same-sex marriage debate. This video is the first in a three part series on building the case against same-sex marriage.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Two Questions on Same Sex Marriage
description:
The debate over same-sex marriage - what it is and if it should be legal - reached all the way to the Supreme Court of the United States.While many different opinions and arguments have been made against the idea of defining marriage to include homosexual couples , there are two questions that focus on the crux of marriage: "Why is marriage only for two people?" and "What about the children? Do they have rights that are being violated?" 

In this video, Lenny expands on why these tow questions are the key in helping more people understand just what we can lose if we as a society open the door to same-sex unions. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Can Governments Define Marriage?
description:
The issue of what marriage is who should be allowed to marry is making headlines around the world. With the homosexual lobby pushing for states to recognize same-sex marriage, it becomes more important than ever to understand just what marriage means and who has control over its definition.

In this video, Lenny explains that marriage stems not from any law or court decision, but from the same source as human equality: natural law. Thus marriage, like human equality, cannot be redefined. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: The Moral Argument for God's Existence - Introduction
description:
Atheists claim the God of the Bible is evil, but what makes an action good or evil? Are right and wrong simply what we all agree upon or must they originate in something bigger than humanity? In this video series, Lenny explores what morality requires and why the existence of right and wrong means God must exist.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Is Morality Grounded in Nature, Utility, or God?
description:
Just as there are three possible sources for moral obligations (determined, designed, or discovered--see previous video), there are three competing ideas offered today for the grounding of morality. Can one derive objective moral principles from naturalism or utilitarianism or must moral law be grounded in God alone? In this last of a four-part series, Lenny discusses the problems with both naturalistic and utilitarian view of morality and shows why moral values and duties are rooted in God and his laws.  

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Talking Faith Without Fighting
description:
Sharing your faith can be difficult - passionate discussions can sometimes lead to angry words or hurt feelings.  But, is this the way we should share the Gospel?  

Watch this recent message where Lenny offers some specific tactics for sharing your faith to help you present the truth in a loving, winsome way.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: The Evil of Scientology (Part 2)
description:
You've probably seen the commercials for Dianetics or walked past some folks offering a free personality test. Both are ways to entice you into the Church of Scientology. But the sheen of the commercials hide a deadly secret that we must warn our friends and family against. Watch here as Lenny exposes the darkness of Scientology.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: The Evil of Scientology (Part 1)
description:
You've probably seen the commercials for Dianetics or walked past some folks offering a free personality test. Both are ways to entice you into the Church of Scientology. But the sheen of the commercials hide a deadly secret that we must warn our friends and family against. Watch here as Lenny exposes the darkness of Scientology.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Where Do Moral Values Originate?
description:
Most people recognize that moral values and obligations are real. However, they disagree strongly on where moral values come from. In this clip, Lenny explores the three possible origins of moral obligations: they are either determined by nature, they are designed by men, or they are discovered as something independent of ourselves and our world. See which concept makes the most sense.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Marissa's Story: Turning an Atheist Towards God
description:
Apologetics Missions Trips can be so powerful, both for those going as well as the people they reach.  in this short interview, Marissa tells of her first-time experience on an Apologetics Missions Trip to U.C. Berkeley. There, she was able to engage an atheist and in one conversation made the Berkeley student rethink his dismissal of God.  For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Apologetics Missions Trips: Making an Impact
description:
Just what is an Apologetics Missions Trip? Why go to places like Berkeley? After just returning from one of these trips, students tell first hand how powerful these trips can be.

In this video" several of the attendees tell of how this trip changed them and their relationship with Christ.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Putting Christianity to the Test
description:
Of all the religions in the world, Christianity is unique. It bases its entire existence on a historical event that we can check out for ourselves. In this short introduction, Lenny talks of how the Apostle Paul hangs the entire Christian faith on the single thread of Jesus's resurrection from the dead, and how others have tried to topple the faith, but wound up being converted themselves when they investigated the evidence.  For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: What Do We Mean by Morality?
description:
It's quite popular today to believe that morality is not something that stands above all of humanity but that moral laws are themselves created by humans. Consistent Christians should deny this view; the Bible teaches that moral duties come from God and are therefore objective and not relative to an individual or to a culture. Yet, most people don't have a good understanding of what we even mean by morality or what is necessary for certain values and duties to be considered moral at all. 

In this video clip, Lenny reviews three specific components that must be accounted for in any moral framework: how do moral obligations obtain, does the person have real moral freedom, and is there a genuine responsibility that attaches the obligation to the person in question. Any theory of morality that is missing one of these components cannot explain morality in any meaningful way.  For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Why Doesn't God Provide More Proof He Exists?
description:
It's an objection that has been thrown around for years; if God exists, why doesn't he make himself more obvious? Certainly a miracle would convince the hardened atheist, right? Not necessarily. 

In this short video, Lenny tackles the question head on and shows that sometimes more proof is not better and maybe the problem lies with those who just don't want to see the evidence in front of them. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Romancing the Mind: Why Apologetics is Crucial for Women
description:
Women are crucial in service to the body of Christ. Women tend to pray more than men, tend to volunteer more, and attend service more, too.Most churches offer different ministries aimed at women, from Bible studies to cooking and craft workshops. Yet, there are very few  women's classes aimed at teaching them how to develop their minds and thoughtfully engage the culture with the reasons for their faith. This is a glaring omission for both Christian women and the churches that serve them,

In this full length video, Lenny had the chance to present to a women's home bible study group and explain why women need to develop a not only a strong spiritual relationship with God, but also a strong intellectual one as well. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Jehovah's Witnesses, the Bible, and Bias
description:
The Jehovah's Witnesses claim that both the Bible we read and orthodox Christian theology has been some kind of trinitarian bias that unwittingly leads us to believe Jesus is God. However, when looking at the doctrines of the Jehovah's Witnesses and their  sponsoring organization, Watchtower Bible and Tract Society, it becomes clear that the only bias on display is their own.

Watch this short clip as Lenny explains how the JWs misunderstand the name of God,  proper biblical interpretation, and how they deliberately change passages of Scripture to try and dodge the conclusion that Jesus is God.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Questions for Skeptics: Why Aren't You More Skeptical of Your Morality?
description:
A lot of skeptics object to the God of the Bible as being cruel, intolerant, genocidal, or worse. All of these claims hinge on a specific moral position, though. How does the skeptic know that he or she has the appropriate moral high ground? From where does their morality stem? 

In this short video, Lenny discusses the problem of moral grounding and asks why these skeptics don't question their own moral position in the same way they question God's. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Questions to Ask Skeptics: What About the Problem of Evil?
description:
One of the more difficult questions many Christians face from skeptics is the question "How can a God exist when I see so much evil in the world?" While this is a challenge to many people, one should realize that the evil we face is more of a problem for the atheist worldview.

In this short video clip, Lenny highlights how rather than disproving God, Christianity provides the most satisfying response to the human struggle with evil and suffering. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Questions to Ask Skeptics: Why Are You So Intolerant?
description:
Those critical of Christianity seem to always have a lot of objections they throw at Christians. They ask question after question, seeing if the believer can answer what they believe are seemingly intractable problems. 

Well, the reason-giving game goes both ways. Here, Lenny offers one of five questions the Christian should ask of the skeptic. These questions are designed to show how many of the critic's own beliefs can be contradictory and why Christianity makes sense.  For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: How We Are Created in the Image of God?
description:
There seems to be a lot of confusion people have over the biblical teaching that man is created in God's image. Some falsely believe it means that God must be a human being with a body.  However, this cannot be right as God has revealed himself as a spirit. 

In this short clip, Lenny explains just what the phrase "created in God's image" means and lists several specific attributes that only humans and God share.

For more on this idea, see the Come Reason article "How is Man Created in the Image of God?" at http://www.comereason.org/created-in-the-image-of-god.asp

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: The Date of Christmas has Nothing to Do with Pagan Holidays
description:
Is Christmas really just a repackaging of a Roman Feast? Two Roman celebrations, Saturnalia and Sol Invictus, were celebrated in December. However, that doesn't mean that Christians used those dates to create a holiday of their own. In this short excerpt, Lenny demonstrates how December 25 has its origin in a Christian tradition and why it makes no sense to think that early Christians were trying to come up with their own alternative to pagan holidays. 

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Defending the Trinity Against World Religions
description:
In this video class, Lenny helps believers defend critical challenges against the Trinity such as it's a logical contradiction, the word Trinity is not found in the Bible, and the Trinity is too mysterious and unintelligible for us to understand. Plus we look at common objections to the Trinity from Islam, Mormonism, Jehovah's Witnesses and others.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Why Doesn't God Heal Amputees?
description:
One objection to God's existence that has become popular in atheist circles is the fact that God won't heal amputees. A web site of that name argues, "The Bible clearly promises that God answers prayers... So what should happen if we pray to God to restore amputated limbs? Clearly, if God is real, limbs should regenerate through prayer. In reality, they do not."

In this short video, Lenny answers the charge that God is not real because he won't heal amputees and shows why the objection fails. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Why The Trinity Is Not a Contradiction
description:
One of the main criticisms of Christianity is it's description of God as a Triune being. Others have charged that the concept of three-in-one is a contradiction, but most don't understand just what the doctrine of the Trinity entails.

Here, in this short video, Lenny offers a deductive argument to prove that the doctrine of the Trinity is not contradictory.For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: How to Become More Than a "Happy Meal" Christian
description:
As Christians we need to do more than just consume the easy doctrines of Christianity or those that make us feel better. In order to wholly love God, we need to love him with our hearts, minds, souls, and strength.

Christian, it's time to develop a sophisticated relationship with God. Make the move from mac and cheese to maturity and you will be on your way to developing a four-star faith. 

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: The Explosion in Apologetics Education
description:
Christians find their faith questioned more than ever before. That's one reason we are seeing an explosion in ways believers can learn to defend their faith with reason and precision. Here, Lenny sits down with Dr. Craig Hazen, who is the Founder and Director of M.A. Program in Christian Apologetics at Biola University to talk about the incredible growth of apologetics and the increasingly diverse programs available to those who wish to study apologetics at home or for a degree. 

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: The Heresies of Mormonism
description:
What is a heresy? Any belief that denies those Christians have historically recognized as essential to the faith; such beliefs include the triune nature of God, the divinity and humanity of Jesus Christ, His eternality,  and the nature of His incarnation. Mormonism rejects these essentials and substitutes its own fictions. Here, Lenny takes a brief look at the teachings of the LDS church and demonstrates why Mormonism is not a Christian faith.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Two Key Problems with Darwinism
description:
Modern Darwinism teaches that all life we see today is the result of lucky chemical accidents. There is no purpose or intelligence guiding the process. However, as we better understand the complexities of life and the amazing amount of information it takes to make even the simplest of cells, the Darwinian model just doesn't work. 

In this video, Lenny teaches on two insurmountable problems for modern Darwinian theory and shows why life points to an intelligent designer.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Free Will Defense
description:
Why would God allow evil and sin to plague humanity? In this short clip, Lenny explains how God's desire to create creatures that truly love Him means that God must allow those creatures the freedom to choose. That means they could also choose to rebel. This clip is taken from a longer teaching entitled "How Could a Loving God Allow Evil in the World?" 

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Christianity and Superhero Movies
description:
They're smashing box office records and have become one of Hollywood's most bankable formats. But why are movies like The Avengers, Captain America, and the Dark Knight so popular? And do they hold a secret to sharing the Gospel? Listen to this class and find out how superheroes derive their power from the Christian tradition.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

Note;  All video clips presented here are courtesy of the Warner Bros Entertainment and Sony Pictures Entertainment. They are used as part of the FAIR USE copyright law for educational purposes and commentary.

title: Defending Your Faith May Help Save a Christian
description:
Why should Christians learn how to defend their faith? Many  people think that while specialists like professional apologists can argue for Christianity, it isn't necessary for the person in the pew to know all those things. Perhaps it's better to ignore the Jehovah's Witness or Mormons knocking on your door, rather than get into countless arguments. However, such an attitude may be more dangerous than you know, and we can lose church members because of it.

Watch this short video where Lenny tells about one man who left the Baptist church to become a Jehovah's Witness because his pastor wouldn't help answer the objections they gave him. Apologetics can help keep Christians in the fold as well as provide reasons for those outside the faith.

 For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Modern Heresies: Christian Science
description:
What is Christian Science? How does it relate to historic Christianity? In this video, Kenny reviews a bit of the history and beliefs of Mary Baker Eddy and the Church of Christ, Scientist. Drawing parallels to the ancient heresy of Gnosticism, Lenny show why Christian Science is really a wolf in sheep's clothing.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this and many other subjects, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: "What Skeptics Wish Christians Knew"  - Sean McDowell Update
description:
We recently caught up with Sean McDowell who had just finished presenting a talk at an apologetics conference sponsored by the Evangelical Philosophical Society. Sean gives us a brief overview on why this message is so close to his heart and he also talked about some of his books, the Apologetics Study Bible for Students, and his research into the martyrdom of the apostles.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Jehovah's Witnesses and Jesus: What does "Firstborn" Mean?
description:
One of the main problems with Jehovah's Witnesses is their denial of the deity of Jesus.  They claim that the Bible teaches that Jesus is a created being and point to passages like Colossians 1:15 and Proverbs 8:22 to make their point.

In this video, Lenny dispels those teachings by showing what the word firstborn really means and why Jesus must be more than someone who is created. For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: The Best Question to Ask In Apologetics
description:
When defending or sharing your faith, many people ask "What's the one thing to say that will change someone's mind? What's the best argument to give?" Actually, the best thing is to ask a question, not preach a sermon. Many times Christians can forget that one is talking with a person, not an opponent. Here, in this short story, I share one encounter I had with a Jehovah's Witness and how asking a question made all the difference in the ensuing conversation.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Is Christmas Really a Pagan Holiday?
description:
Every Christmas  the charge is made that the holiday and its symbols were originally pagan celebrations that Christians usurped for their own purposes.  Is this true?  is Christmas just a cheap imitation of a Roman Solstice celebration? Did Christians attempt to convert unbelievers by allowing them to keep their festivals? As the holiday season approaches, we'll show why such a charge can be easily dismissed.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Heresies and Scripture
description:
Were books left out of the Bible? What are heresies against scripture? How did the early church determine which writings should be recognized as scripture and which shouldn't? In this one hour lecture, Lenny reviews the heretical movements that plagued the early church in regards to Scripture. The teaching is part of the Deepening Your Faith series put on at Harvest Christian Fellowship. For more information on that class, visit http://deepfaith.harvest.org/

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: The Great Debate: Does God Exist?  Q&A  from Lenny Esposito and Richard Carrier
description:
Does God Exist? Philosophers and theologians have written volumes on this topic, but it has become especially significant in our modern world. In this riveting debate, Lenny Esposito and famed atheist Richard Carrier go head-to-head to try and settle the question "Does God Exist?" Recorded in front of a packed house at the University of California Riverside, this multi-disc set provides over five hours of stimulating debate, discussion, and answers to one of the greatest questions in human existence.

This debate is part of a larger DVD set that includes the live debate, an extended question and answer session with the students at UC Riverside, a debate transcript,as well as Lenny's post-debate analysis of Carrier's arguments in an mp3 audio file. You may purchase the set at http://www.comereason.org/resources/debate.asp

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: The Great Debate: Does God Exist? Lenny Esposito versus Richard Carrier
description:
Does God Exist? Philosophers and theologians have written volumes on this topic, but it has become especially significant in our modern world. In this riveting debate, Lenny Esposito and famed atheist Richard Carrier go head-to-head to try and settle the question "Does God Exist?" Recorded in front of a packed house at the University of California Riverside, this multi-disc set provides over five hours of stimulating debate, discussion, and answers to one of the greatest questions in human existence.

This debate is part of a larger DVD set that includes the live debate, an extended question and answer session with the students at UC Riverside, a debate transcript,as well as Lenny's post-debate analysis of Carrier's arguments in an mp3 audio file. title: Can God Do Absolutely Anything?
description:
Can God do anything? Why can't He do something about evil? Why can't He make everyone truly free but still choose to worship Him?  In this short clip, Lenny explains that God's omnipotence doesn't mean he can do anything you can think of, just those things that are consistent with His character. 

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Dr. Walt Russell on God And Technology
description:
During a recent  class at Harvest Christian Fellowship, Dr. Walt Russell (Talbot School of Theology, Biola) gave a great object lesson on how instead of thanking God for the technological advances he allows us to discover, we turn technology into an idol. Go to deepfaith.harvest.org for the full series of talks.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Wasn't Jesus Just One of Many Messiahs?
description:
Skeptics and films such as the Zeitgeist movie make the claim that Jesus' story is not unique.  There were many saviors in ancient religious systems and the gospels were just borrowing from earlier myths. Is this true? See why we can dismiss claims of ancient plagiarism as so much hogwash.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Is the Flying Spaghetti Monster as Justified as Belief in God?
description:
Have you heard of the Flying Spaghetti Monster?  This thought experiment is supposed to show that belief in God is just as silly as believing  in a pasta-based supreme being.  However, when you look carefully, the comparison falls short pretty quickly.  See how these two concepts measure up when answering the question "Why is there something rather than nothing?" 

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Can we get a universe out of nothing?
description:
For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:
Can we get a universe out of nothing? Here, Lenny explains why the well-known phrase "Out of nothing , nothing comes" still holds up.

http://www.comereason.org
