title: Can We Be Equal on Evolution's View?
description:
If the neo-Darwinian model is true and we are merely the product of chance filtered through our environment, then how can it be that people are to be considered equal? Listen to this poignant question and underscoring some of the implications of the new evolutionary paradigm.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Pro Choice arguments for Abortion: "We'd mess up three lives"
description:
This is a video reply to Tour√© and his claim that "abortion saved my life." Many times we hear that an abortion is necessary not only for the mother, but for the child and the father, too.  It is said that all three lives would be destroyed if the pregnancy were to continue.  Here, Lenny dispels that reasoning. A fuller answer and link to the original video may be found at http://bit.ly/UAuzuj.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Do Mormons become gods or are they merely  "like God"?
description:
When discussing the LDS view of exaltation, Christians have noted that becoming God is not only a polytheistic belief, but it is self-contradictory. Many Mormons have responded that we don't become equal with God, we just become like him.  But this doesn't solve their problem.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Is the Mormon View of Marriage Better?
description:
One common way LDS adherents note that their faith is more comforting is to note that in Mormonism, a husband and wife will be married for all of eternity.  But is this the best model?  Listen as Lenny answers this question and shows why the Mormon view actually limits relationships.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason
https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: J.P. Moreland's 2012 EPS Address
description:
J.P. Moreland was the guest speaker at the welcoming reception for the Evangelical Philosophical Society's Annual Meeting.  J.P. provided a message of  encouragement and incentive for Christian philosophers, apologists, and students to continue their important work for Christ and His kingdom. J.P. stated that both the academy and the local church are in need of trustworthy and dedicated spokespersons for the cause and means of the Kingdom of God.

Given in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, on Wednesday, November 14th

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org

https://www.facebook.com/comeletusreason

title: Mike Licona Discusses What Makes a Bible Contradiction
description:
Lenny interviews Dr. Michael Licona, an expert on historical approaches and the New Testament.  Here, Mike explains what a contradiction is, what it is not, and how looking at the biblical texts from the perspective of a historian gives support to the veracity of the documents.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org
http://twitter.com/comereason

title: Dr. Gary Habermas - Beyond Standard Apologetics Categories
description:
From the Evangelical Philosophical Society's Annual Meeting.

Dr. Gary Habermas of Liberty University notes new developments in the study of Christian apologetics and tells how these advancements are making a difference in sharing and defending the faith.

Form more apologetics resources, podcasts, and videos, visit Come Reason Ministries at the links below.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org

title: Horus vs Jesus
description: The Zeitgeist movie makes the claim that the stories of Jesus are just copies of the ancient Egyptian dying and rising myth of Horus. The film lists several supposed similarities between the two stories in an attempt to prove that the Gospels were simply fabricated from pre-existing material. Here, Lenny compares the actual myth of Horus to the Gospel accounts and you can see how the claims of similarity quickly fades away.

title: Did the Gospels Copy from Pagan Myths?
description:
Is the story of Jesus an old tale told often before He lived? Does that
impugn the truth value of the Gospel accounts? Richard Carrier and
others have claimed that the story of Jesus is simply a retelling of
older messiah myths, but see why this couldn't be true.

title: Setting the Record Straight: The Truth About Homosexual Marriage (part 2)
description:
Christians can no longer be passive about the issue of homosexual marriage. The recent public condemnation of Chick-fil-A CEO Dan Cathy shows that even when stating one's personal beliefs, you and your livelihood can come under attack. Unfortunately, when challenged to defend the biblical view of marriage, too many Christians have little more to offer than "because the Bible tells me so."

Join Lenny and our special guest, Greg Koukl for part 2 of this talk where we offer thoughtful arguments from a secular perspective as to why homosexual marriage policies are more harm than help..

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, follow us online:

http://www.comereason.org

Christians can no longer be passive about the issue of homosexual marriage. title: Answering Bill Nye Videos on Teaching Creationism
description:
Is Bill Nye right when he claims that we shouldn't teach creationism to
our kids? This video has really taken off online, however Bill Nye's views are a little simplistic. His concept of creation is merely a caricature and he glosses over many of the difficult issues with the evolutionary framework. 

Here, Lenny responds to the claims Nye makes and shows why his position is really untenable. For more articles and information about Lenny and Come Reason, visit http://www.comereason.org/

title: 2012 Dare to Defend Apologetics Training
description:
Join Lenny Esposito and Brett Kunkle from February 27 to March 12 as
they equip you to better defend your faith.

title: We Don't Know What We Believe (Christian Megathemes part 1)
description:
Is the Church Letting Itself Get Corrupted by the World? There are six megathemes--shifts in the way Christians think and act--that show how much the world's ideas are corrupting the church today. The first is the fact that the Christian Church is becoming less theologically literate. We have Christians who don't even know why we celebrate Easter! See the danger this represents and what we can do about it.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, visit http://www.comereason.org

title: Postmodern Ideas are Winning Over the Christian Church (Christian Megathemes part 5)
description:
When the Church abandons truth, it is one of the most offensive acts you can imagine. This is the fifth of six megathemes--shifts in the way Christians think and act that show how much the world's ideas are corrupting the church today. The concept of tolerance is so prevalent today that you cannot help but be pummeled by it anywhere you turn. It's a huge problem and a big danger to the health of Christianity. As the influence of relativism becomes more dominant in society, we need to be more intentional in countering its message.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, visit http://www.comereason.org

title: The Influence of Christianity is Largely Invisible (Christian Megathemes part 6)
description:
Imagine Thomas Jefferson wanting to stay anonymous when the U.S. was founded. We're dealing with six megathemes--shifts in the way Christians think and act--that show how much the world's ideas are corrupting the church today. In this final clip, we note that the influence of Christianity on culture and individual lives has become largely invisible. It's not that there is no influence, it's simply that no one realizes how much Christianity matters to society.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, visit http://www.comereason.org

title: Reaching Your Community by Intentionally Reaching Out (Christian Megathemes part 4)
description:
Christians want to take action today! There are six megathemes--shifts in the way Christians think and act--that show how much the world's ideas are corrupting the church today. The forth megatheme shows that among Christians, interest in participating in community action is escalating. There is a general desire by the youth of the nation to find something more meaningful in their lives. That means the Church has a great opportunity to reach out in love, to touch the lives of others and to show one way Christianity is still incredibly relevant in the world today.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, visit http://www.comereason.org

title: Thinking Less About Stuff and More About God  (Christian Megathemes part 3)
description:
Is pragmatism replacing piety in the church today? There are six megathemes--shifts in the way Christians think and act--that show how much the world's ideas are corrupting the church today. In the third of our six-part series, Lenny notes that growing numbers of people are less interested in spiritual principles and more desirous of learning pragmatic solutions for life. But by avoiding wrestling with ethical and theological questions, we are doomed to hold a very superficial view of both Christianity AND life. That is not only sin, it is a travesty of living.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, visit http://www.comereason.org

title: Christianity Is Not a Private Party (Christian Megathemes part 2)
description:
Is Christianity stuck in a Holy Huddle? There are six megathemes--shifts in the way Christians think and act--that show how much the world's ideas are corrupting the church today. In this second of a six-part series, we look at the charge that Christians are becoming more ingrown and less outreach-oriented.How can we reach the world if we're only talking to ourselves?

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, visit http://www.comereason.org

title: Why Doesn't God Only Create People Who Want to be Saved? (Hell Series part 5)
description:
Couldn't God, being all -knowing, simply create only people He knew would choose to freely be saved?  Wouldn't that eliminate the need for suffering in hell? In our last installment of the series focused on answering "Love Wins" by Rob Bell, Lenny looks at what it means to freely choose God and says that God's purposes may be bigger than just saving a few people.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, visit http://www.comereason.org

title: Why Can't God Just Save Everyone? (Hell Series part 4)
description:
If God is all powerful, couldn't He simply create human beings who would freely choose to be saved?  Wouldn't that do away with the need for Hell? In this forth installment of the series focused on answering "Love Wins" by Rob Bell, Lenny looks at what it means to be free and why God would create people he knows will be destined for eternal punishment.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, visit http://www.comereason.org

title: Why Would God Allow Peope to Suffer for Eternity in Hell? (Hell Series part 3)
description:
If God is all just, then how can He let people suffer eternally for a finite amount of sins they have committed in this life?  Doesn't that make God cruel? In this third installment of the series focused on answering "Love Wins" by Rob Bell, Lenny takes on this objection and shows why those in hell can continue to sin.

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, visit http://www.comereason.org

title: Why would a loving God send people to Hell? (Hell Series part 2)
description:
If God is all-loving, how can He stand to send people to Hell?  If He is all-powerful, hen He should certainly be able to do something about Hell, right?  In this second installment of the series focused on answering "Love Wins" by Rob Bell, Lenny offers a definitive answer to the question "Why would a loving God send people to Hell?".

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, visit http://www.comereason.org

title: Rob Bell and the question of Hell (Hell Series part 1)
description:
Recently, the book "Love Wins" by Rob Bell caused quite a stir in the Christian community. In this first of a five-part series on Hell and the problems with Rob Bell's book, Lenny looks at how the Bible portrays hell and why a loving God would create such a place to begin with. 

For more articles, podcasts, and teachings on this subject, visit http://www.comereason.org

title: Mike Licona talks about the problems historians face.
description:
Dr. Michael Licona, a recognized expert on the resurrection, presents a paper at the Annual Meeting of the Evangelical Philosophical Society based on the research done for his book "The Resurrection of Jesus: A New Historiographical Approach."   Here he discusses a bit of the difficulties historians face in unearthing historical facts.

Come to Come Reason's Dare to Defend Conference April 8 & 9, 2011 to hear more from Dr.Licona!

title: 2010 Apologetics Missions Trip - Day 1
description: Follow us as Come Reason takes a group of students to the University of California Berkeley to learn how to defend their faith.
